parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
